name: IDES Data Preparation.NET
tagline: An example of the data preparation process using .NET Framework
body:
### IDES Data Preparation
The International Data Exchange Service (IDES) is a secure managed file transfer service that allows financial institutions and foreign tax authorities to securely send information on financial accounts held by U.S. taxpayers in accordance with the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (FATCA). 

The IDES Data Preparation.NET project repository demonstrates a working application built using [Microsoft Visual Studio 2013 Community edition](http://www.visualstudio.com/en-us/products/free-developer-offers-vs).  There are many tools available that may produce the same results. The IRS does not endorse any software applications or commercial products.

The example explains how to create a new project and use the code to build an application that will create a valid transmission and process notifications through IDES. The project starts with a validated FATCA XML file. The application will digitally sign, encrypt, compress, and archive the data packet into a compliant .ZIP format that is ready for transmission in IDES.

Open **Visual Studio**, select **New Project**.
![Image 1](http://irsgov.github.io/IDES-Data-Preparation-Dot-Net/images/img1.png)

#### Create a New Project 
![Image 2](http://irsgov.github.io/IDES-Data-Preparation-Dot-Net/images/img2.png)
Under **New Project**, select the settings Visual C#, Windows Desktop and Windows Forms Application. Verify the settings, name and location. Click **OK** to continue.

#### Adding References
![Image 3](http://irsgov.github.io/IDES-Data-Preparation-Dot-Net/images/img3.png)
Next, you will add a reference to the each of the following:
* System.IO.Compression
* System.IO.Compression.FileSystem
* System.Security  
Select the **Project ** and **Add Reference** from the program menu. The **Reference Manager-SignXML** screen appears. Select the checkbox next to each entry and click **OK**.


#### Adding Components
![Image 4](/images/img4.png)
In the **Designer Interface**, add the components listed below. The selections are used when you run the application. Figure 4 above shows a sample layout.
Label – lblLoadXM|Label – lblReceiverCert  
TextBox – txtXmlFile|	TextBox – txtReceiverCert  
Button – btnBrowseXml|	Button – btnBrowseRecCert  
Label – lblCert|	Label – lblRecPass  
TextBox – txtCert|	TextBox – txtRecKeyPassword*   
Button – btnBrowseCert|	Button – btnDecryptZip  
Label – lblCertPass	Label – lblSender  
TextBox – txtCertPass* 	TextBox – txtSenderCode  
Label – lblKeyCert	Label – lblReceiver  
TextBox – txtKeyCert	TextBox – txtReceiverCode  
Button – btnBrowseKeyCert	Label – lblOutput  
Label – lblKeyEncryptionCertPassword	TextBox – txtNotificationFolder  
TextBox – txtKeyCertPassword	Button – btnBrowseOutput  
Button – btnSignXML	OpenFileDialog - dlgOpen  
Label – lblZipFile	SaveFileDialog – dlgSave
TextBox – txtNotificationZip	FolderBrowserDialog - dlgOpenFolder
Button – btnBrowseNotificationZip	


```
$ cd your_repo_root/repo_name
$ git fetch origin
$ git checkout gh-pages
```





### Authors and Contributors
